doc.title: MTiOpenScreen

comment.text: Virtual screening service allows to screen a curated library of small compounds in order to identify which compounds are likely to bind to given protein receptor.

doc.authors: Labbé CM, Rey J, Lagorce D, Vavrusa M, Becot J, Sperandio O, Villoutreix BO, Tufféry P, Miteva MA.
doc.reference: MTiOpenScreen: a web server for structure-based virtual screening. Nucleic Acids Res. 2015 Jul 1;43(W1):W448-54. doi: 10.1093/nar/gkv306. Epub 2015 Apr 8.

div.label: Fill the service form with preset data
div.div: Note: MTiOpenScreen will load a pre-configured test case. Click the "Reset" button above to reset the form.

div.label:
Receptor format?
pdb mol2
Please specify the input receptor file format.

div.div: Either PDB or MOL2 is accepted.

div.label:
Select library for the compound (use the database filters below)
iPPI-lib diverse-lib Drugs-lib FOOD-lib NP-lib

fieldset.legend: Custom compound library (in 3D, protonated and up to 5000 compounds)?

div.div: User-provided library of small compounds, you have to either provide your own database or use one of the provided with the database filters. Either MOL2 or SDF is accepted.

div.label: Limit the number of ligands to

Is lead-like??
Yes No
If the selection of "lead-like" molecules is enabled, you should not input other parameters. If you do so, they will be ommited.
Only compounds with the number of hydrogen bond acceptors lower than
Only compounds with the number of hydrogen bonds donors lower than
Only compounds with the LogP lower than
Only compounds with the molecular weight lower than
Only compounds with the number of rotatable bonds lower than
Only compounds with the topological polar surface area lower than

Mode
Custom parameters List of residues

div.div:
Unlike AutoDock, Vina accepts search space size in Angstroms. Maximum recommended grid size is 27000 A^3, but if you really intended to use an unusually large search space, you can ignore this warning, but note that the search algorithm's job may be harder.
Example: 30x30x30 means 27000 A^3

fieldset.legend: Calculate grid from a list of residues (list of residues mode)

div.label:
List of residues separated by commas (i.e. "_A_PHE_919__,_A_ALA_866__")?
The comma-separated list of residues must be of the following form and not contain white-space or special characters: CHAIN ID, RESIDUE 3-LETTERS CODE, RESIDUE #.
Example: _A_THR_1__,_A_THR_2__,_A_ILE_7__.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Please specify the input receptor file format.
Either PDB or MOL2 is accepted.
User-provided library of small compounds, you have to either provide your own database or use one of the provided with the database filters. Either MOL2 or SDF is accepted.
If the selection of "lead-like" molecules is enabled, you should not input other parameters. If you do so, they will be ommited.

xhtml:fieldset.xhtml:legend: Calculate grid from a list of residues (list of residues mode)

xhtml:div.xhtml:div:
The comma-separated list of residues must be of the following form and not contain white-space or special characters: CHAIN ID, RESIDUE 3-LETTERS CODE, RESIDUE #.
Example: _A_THR_1__,_A_THR_2__,_A_ILE_7__.

Note: The bioactive compounds are rarely ranked in the top 1 % of the virtually screened compound library. Thus, the visualized here top ranked 100 ligands using MTiOpenScreen are only an illustration of the docking results and the binding site. You may need to proceed a thorough analysis of a larger number of ligands among the 1000 top ranked compounds provided to download by using standalone programs like PyMOL or AutoDockTools for a final selection of the best potential compound candidates.
The 3 top scored poses for the 1000 top ranked compounds screened using AutoDock Vina ranked by binding energy; binding energies; physico-chemical descriptors of ligands.
The 3 top scored poses for the 1000 top ranked compounds screened using AutoDock Vina ranked by binding energy; binding energies; physico-chemical descriptors of ligands.

comment.text: Please specify the input receptor file format.

interface.label:
Receptor format?
pdb mol2

comment.text: Either PDB or MOL2 is accepted.

div.div: Either PDB or MOL2 is accepted.

parameter.name: library
parameter.prompt: Select library for the compound (use the database filters below)

format.code: ("", " --library iPPI-lib ", " --library diverse-lib ", " --built-in-db Drug_DB ", " --built-in-db FOOD_DB ", " --built-in-db NP_DB ")[ int(value) ]

interface.label:
Select library for the compound (use the database filters below)
iPPI-lib diverse-lib Drugs-lib FOOD-lib NP-lib

comment.text: User-provided library of small compounds, you have to either provide your own database or use one of the provided with the database filters. Either MOL2 or SDF is accepted.

Is lead-like??
Yes No

Custom parameters List of residues

format.code: ("", " --gridcentercrds=" + str(gridcenter_x) + "," + str(gridcenter_y) + "," + str(gridcenter_z))[grid_calculation_mode == "custom" and (gridcenter_x is not None)]

comment.div:
Unlike AutoDock, Vina accepts search space size in Angstroms. Maximum recommended grid size is 27000 A^3, but if you really intended to use an unusually large search space, you can ignore this warning, but note that the search algorithm's job may be harder.
Example: 30x30x30 means 27000 A^3

format.code: ("", " --gridpts " + str(gridpts_x) + "," + str(gridpts_y) + "," + str(gridpts_z))[grid_calculation_mode == "custom" and (gridpts_x is not None)]

message.text: You must fill in all coordinates.

ctrl.code: ( ((gridpts_x is not None) and (gridpts_y is not None) and (gridpts_z is not None)) or (grid_calculation_mode == "custom") )

paragraph.name: residues
paragraph.prompt: Calculate grid from a list of residues (list of residues mode)

parameter.name: residues_list
parameter.prompt: List of residues separated by commas (i.e. "_A_PHE_919__,_A_ALA_866__")

comment.div:
The comma-separated list of residues must be of the following form and not contain white-space or special characters: CHAIN ID, RESIDUE 3-LETTERS CODE, RESIDUE #.
Example: _A_THR_1__,_A_THR_2__,_A_ILE_7__.

comment.text: Note: The bioactive compounds are rarely ranked in the top 1 % of the virtually screened compound library. Thus, the visualized here top ranked 100 ligands using MTiOpenScreen are only an illustration of the docking results and the binding site. You may need to proceed a thorough analysis of a larger number of ligands among the 1000 top ranked compounds provided to download by using standalone programs like PyMOL or AutoDockTools for a final selection of the best potential compound candidates.
